quotes.quote: There is an important sense in which government is distinctive from administration. One is perpetual, the other is temporary and changeable. A man may be loyal to his government and yet oppose the particular principles and methods of administration.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: While the people retain their virtue, and vigilance, no administration, by any extreme of wickedness or folly, can very seriously injure the government, in the short space of four years.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: There is no nonsense so arrant that it cannot be made the creed of the vast majority by adequate governmental action.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: For every action there is an equal and opposite government program.
quotes.author: Bob Wells

quotes.quote: Government is too big and too important to be left to the politicians.
quotes.author: Chester Bowles

quotes.quote: Many people consider the things which government does for them as social progress, but they consider the things government does for others as socialism.
quotes.author: Earl Warren

quotes.quote: After two years in Washington, I often long for the realism and sincerity of Hollywood.
quotes.author: Fred Thompson

quotes.quote: You know what's interesting about Washington? It's the kind of place where second-guessing has become second nature.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: I believe that truth is the glue that holds government together , not only our government but civilization itself. That bond, though strained, is unbroken at home and abroad.
quotes.author: Gerald R. Ford

quotes.quote: If the government is big enough to give you everything you want, it is big enough to take away everything you have.
quotes.author: Gerald R. Ford

quotes.quote: In a political sense, there is one problem that currently underlies all of the others. That problem is making Government sufficiently responsive to the people. If we dont make government responsive to the people, we dont make it believable. And we must make government believable if we are to have a functioning democracy.
quotes.author: Gerald R. Ford

quotes.quote: The American wage earner and the American housewife are a lot better economists than most economists care to admit. They know that a government big enough to give you everything you want is a government big enough to take from you everything you have.
quotes.author: Gerald R. Ford

quotes.quote: Every decent man is ashamed of the government he lives under.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: I believe that all government is evil, and that trying to improve it is largely a waste of time.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: The government consists of a gang of men exactly like you and me. They have, taking one with another, no special talent for the business of government; they have only a talent for getting and holding office.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Whenever you have an efficient government you have a dictatorship.
quotes.author: Harry S Truman

quotes.quote: If men were angels, no government would be necessary. If angels were to govern men, neither external nor internal controls on government would be necessary. In framing a government which is to be administered by men over men, the great difficulty lies in this: you must first enable the government to control the governed; and in the next place oblige it to control itself.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: Before my term has ended, we shall have to test anew whether a nation organized and governed such as ours can endure. The outcome is by no means certain.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: You will find that the State is the kind of organization which, though it does big things badly, does small things badly, too.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: The mystery of government is not how Washington works but how to make it stop.
quotes.author: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.quote: What we should be asking is not whether we need a big government or small government, but how we can create a smarter and better government.
quotes.author: Richard M. Nixon

quotes.quote: When our government is spoken of as some menacing, threatening, foreign entity, it ignores the fact that in our democracy, government is us.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Sure there are dishonest men in local government. But there are dishonest men in national government too.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: The best minds are not in government. If any were, business would hire them right away.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: So they [the Government] go on in strange paradox, decided only to be undecided, resolved to be irresolute, adamant for drift, solid for fluidity, all-powerful to be impotent.
quotes.author: Tom Robbins

quotes.quote: We must judge of a form of government by its general tendency, not by happy accidents.
In the long-run every Government is the exact symbol of its People, with their wisdom and unwisdom; we have to say, Like People like Government.
Any government is potentially the worst client in the world you could ever possibly want to have.
Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business.
